TestDescription.name: Django debug mode enabled
TestDescription.Description: This Django web application is running with debug mode turned on ([bold]DEBUG = True[/bold] ). One of the main features of debug mode is the display of detailed error pages. If your app raises an exception when DEBUG is True, Django will display a detailed traceback, including a lot of metadata about your environment, such as all the currently defined Django settings (from settings.py).
TestDescription.Recommendation: Never deploy a site into production with DEBUG turned on. To disable debug mode, set [bold]DEBUG = False[/bold] in your Django settings file.
